title: What is the best IMDB-style site for music? Why? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on what you're looking for. If you need a site that has data that can't normally be quantified, Last.fm is the best. It works by tracking its 40 million users' listening habits, leading to information like common song/album/artist descriptions and related songs. Obviously, data is better for bigger releases, but here's the page for "Let It Be": http://www.last.fm/music/The+Beatles/Let+It+Be/Let+It+Be If you're looking for a more traditional database, try MusicBrainz. It's kind of like Wikipedia for albums; the users list and form relationships between every release by an artist. They even go so far as to catalog bootlegs.

Also there are Musicbrainz and discogs, which are a bit more technically-inclined: MusicBrainz is a community-maintained open source encyclopedia of music information.Musicbrainz can be also used/accessed through MusicBrainz Picard, which is a great tool for editing metadata and renaming files. Discogs is a Database and Marketplace for Music on Vinyl, CD, Cassette and More Discogs is somewhat similar to Musicbrainz; with a bit more technical data (more detailed credits, barcodes, CD/vinyl runout markings, etc.) While these two sites are great for finding out information about a certain piece of music for cataloguing purposes, they do not feature extensive reviews (Musicbrainz just has a 5-star rating system AFAIK, but Discogs has a review system in place), or similar music reccomendations.
